dialogues.text: A King may move a man...a father may claim a son...a man may move himself...and then the man begins his own game. Remember howsoever you are played, or by whom, that your soul is in your keeping. Even though those who presume to play you be kings. Remember. (the mask, in firelight, raises) When you answer to God you cannot say вЂњI was told it was thusвЂќ, or that virtue вЂњwas not the fashion of my timesвЂќ. Remember. BALIAN stares at a PAWN. Flickering light. He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: I will. BALIAN stares at the king. THE KING slides a paper toward Balian, with a drawing on it (basically it is pretty much along the ideas that Balian is thinking) - i.e it has the shape of a cross.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It is a fortification.

dialogues.speaker: THE KING
dialogues.text: (nods ) I have drawn it. What do you think of it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: I have thought, many times, that a castle should be in the shape of a cross. (A stick of charcoal on the table.) May I? THE KING nods, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: THE KING
dialogues.text: Improve it.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: A cross...or a star. Like this. (draws a вЂњstar fortвЂќ) That way, not part of a fortress may be approached without being exposed to fire from another part. 54. THE KING smiles, and furls the paper. He has made the tes

dialogues.speaker: THE KING
dialogues.text: You will go to your house of Ibelin, and protect the pilgrim road. Protect in particular the Jews and the Muslims. (defiant: the Mask comes up) All are welcome in Jerusalem. Not because it is expedient, but because it is right. (a beat: drinks off his cup) Protect the helpless. BALIAN takes it seriously.

dialogues.speaker: THE KING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And when one day I am helpless...perhaps you will protect me. (a beat) You may go. BALIAN looks up The glittering mask. Balian nods, goes ou The KING returns to his lonely chair by the window.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE CORRIDOR. NIGHT
dialogues.text: BALIAN comes out of the kingвЂ™s apartments, and looks do hall. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SIBYLLAвЂ™S DOOR still stands open, light falling into th hall. Balian might well have walked towards the door, but a BOY (SibyllaвЂ™s son) is standing in the hall, staring at Bal expressionlessly. BALIAN raises his hand. The BOY backs a and disappears into his room. A LEAD EQUESTRIAN KNIGHT on floor. BALIAN picks it up, weighs it in his hand. The BOY peeps around the corner again. BALIAN smiles experimental The BOY disappears. BALIAN fixes the soldier, bending a b bit back into place, and places the LEAD KNIGHT on the ed of a balustrade. He goes.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: The king has charged you with your tasks. You keep the peace. (glaring at the men--of Ibelin, and other houses) To break the peace, to rob Saracen, Jew or Christian, is death on the instant. Do you understand. BALIAN nods. His men nod, perhaps more reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC
dialogues.text: Ibelin.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SERGEANT
dialogues.text: That shithole.

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC
dialogues.text: Ssh. TIBERIAS comes up to BALIAN, and privately.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: Be gone to Ibelin. Not least before the princess Sibylla does take you...вЂќridingвЂќ. TIBERIAS smiles, and hands BALIAN some rolled parchments bound with ribbon.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These are my plans of the city defenses. (Balian hesitates respectfully) (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Better them if you can. I defend Jerusalem, not my reputation. BALIAN nods respectfully. TIBERIAS smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEWS by a campfire stand and bow as BALIAN, cloaked, ride past with forty of his mounted men, also cloaked. They ar very much policemen on patrol. FACES of the pilgrims: the young, the old. They ride on, past more CHRISTIAN PILGRIM trudging towards the city -- the mad, the penitent, the merely curious, the barely alive. A NAKED MAN crawls...dr himself along, mumbling. BALIAN looks at him and spurs on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold men by a fire (still unsure of Balian). A SERGEANT h out a plate of boiled wheat. BALIAN takes it and eats wit his fingers. He is aware of the silence and discomfort an plain curiosity of his men. Some are peering at him. BALI puts down his plate, and stands.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: I am not my father. His men, who have been thinking just this, look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I will do my best. BALIAN walks off alone. He sees: A PROCESSION OF CHILDREN singing, on their way to Jerusalem.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ABOVE IBELIN. DAY
dialogues.text: They ride into show, reining in.

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC
dialogues.text: There, my lord. BALIAN rides a little forward.

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ibelin. BALIANвЂ™S POV: IBELIN. A faintly green valley floor, an oasis, a fort th would best be called a вЂњcasbahвЂќ. A village around it.  57.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. IBELIN. DAY
dialogues.text: Establish Ibelin as Balian and his party ride in. WOMEN w buckets hung on poles are carrying water towards the dry MELON FIELDS. The population consists of Jews, Saracens, Arab Christians. The place is desperately poor.

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Your father was important. His lands were not. But to Balian it might as well be paradise.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: I have no importance. It will suit me just fine. Entering the WALLED CASBAH area, BALIAN and his party dismount. PEOPLE stand and stare, keeping their distance. ARAB goes on his knees before BALIAN and Balian courteous helps him up. The ARAB is stunned. BALIAN walks on, removing his gloves, beating the dust ou his surcoat. At the steps of the house he stops: An OLD HOUSEMAN in a skullcap is staring at him, open mouth toothless. BALIAN climbs the stairs. The two men look at each other. OLD HOUSEMAN searches BalianвЂ™s face.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes? He plucks at the ensign on his breast. The OLD HOUSEMAN smiles, and kisses both of BalianвЂ™s cheeks. The PEOPLE are murmuring, respectfully. BALIAN, from the steps of his house, takes it all in. HOR are watering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OLD HOUSEMAN pads ahead through the dark, sunsplinter rooms. Some ruinous furniture, cushions. ALMARIC watches BALIAN warily (still not knowing this guy) as BALIAN take his house. The OLD HOUSEMAN runs up with a slopping cup o wine. BALIAN takes it, sips, and keeps walking. He comes the back of the house, where arched openings give onto th oasis, a green and saline-looking pool under blowing palm (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Twilight is coming on. Balian hears, of all things, chick Along an ell of the house there are chicken coops. AN ARAB GIRL, collecting eggs. She turns, sensing that sh being stared at. She is veiled across. She continues to t eggs from beneath the hens. BALIAN, caught in a memory, dissolves in it. We know as he catches his breath that he alive again, he could have a life here.

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC
dialogues.text: My lord, this is a poor and dusty place.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Is it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. IBELIN. MORNING
dialogues.text: BALIAN and ALMARIC, chased by a horde of children and som more restrained adults, are walking though the farm area. Poor cultivation, dust blowing from cracked dikes.

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC
dialogues.text: We've got Jews...different types of Jews, I think...Fatmid Muslims, and the other... BALIAN, moving along, jumps up on a dike, and continues, children chasing along.

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Easter Christians and Roman... BALIAN stops, windblown, and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: But mainly, we have no water.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NEAR THE POOL. DAY
dialogues.text: Slightly up from the pool, we see that the pool is fed by marshy trickle. BALIAN crouches, looking at the lie of th land.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NEAR THE POOL. LATER
dialogues.text: PEASANTS are digging, already five or six feet down in th dampish ground. BALIAN is with them in the middle of the using a heavy iron pole to slam deep into the earth...bot вЂњsoundingвЂќ and loosening. PEASANTS are taking the damp earth and immediately formin bricks with it.  59.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NEAR THE POOL. LATER
dialogues.text: The well is deeper. Now the walls are shored up with timb BALIAN slams and slams with his iron bar. The men are ank deep in seepage, the shoveled earth goes up in leather buckets on ropes. Suddenly, as BALIAN leans exhausted... The water level rises evenly. The diggers look at each ot

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: (exhausted) Right. Stone the well. As he comes up from the well, the PEOPLE (Jews, Christian Saracens) are exultant--and so is BALIAN, at first shy, a then smiling hugely.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. IBELIN. DAY, (VARIOUS)
dialogues.text: MONTAGE. Irrigation ditches being dug while Balian superv and pitches in. Clay troughs and pipes being manufactured molded, and then set in a great kiln. WOMEN working leath into what may be buckets. BALIAN moves through it all. He crouches with skll-capped ARAB CARPENTERS. He draws in the dirt with a stick while men nod.

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC
dialogues.text: They are making lords different in France from when I was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torches are lit on the rough battlements. BALIAN stares o at the desert, satisfied, in his home. On the road, a solitary pilgrim proceeds to Jerusalem on his knees.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. IBELIN. DAY
dialogues.text: A commotion among the people. They run towards the center some activity. What they see there is wonderful. CARPENTE MEN-AT-ARMS, various helpers, and BALIAN, using brute strength, as well as a rope passing through pulley on a p are setting upright...a giant WATERWHEEL.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Brace it, brace it. Almaric, tell them to brace it! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Almaric does. BALIAN makes sure the wheel is secure. He b away from the work and sees that... An ARAB is staring pen mouthed at something OS. More PEAS stare, and then go to their knees. BALIAN turns and sees: WHIPPETS. They course around in a pack. He looks up and s SIBYLLA, mounted. She is veiled and with a guard of Turcopole lancers. SIBY rides forward through whirling dust and light. She wears sort of burnoose all her face but her eyes covered with s BALIAN walks towards her, through wind, and, without rega to his filthiness, bows. Not particularly courtly. SIBYLLA removes her veil, staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: I am on my way to Cana. That is where Jesus changed water to wine. A better trick would to be to change you to a nobleman.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: In France I used to think that with a few yards of silk I could make an aristocrat of any man, so long as he was useless. Sibylla laughs delightedly. BALIAN smiles. SERVANTS rush her considerable, fantastical baggage-train forward through the casbah gates.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: It seems that I ask your hospitality.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: (holding her bridle) It is given. Sibylla smiles and rides through the gates.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. A ROOM AT IBELIN. DAY
dialogues.text: SERVANTS attend SIBYLLA. They take her cloak, her вЂњturb she reveals and drops her hair. Her вЂњmaskвЂќ of office be entirely in place. A servant removes SIBYLLAвЂ™s small velvet shoes. A servant brushes her hair as another remov her riding gear. A SERVANT unpacks a lead-lined box of...snow, and puts it into a silver goblet. Sibylla drin  61.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. A POOL BEHIND THE CASBAH AT IBELIN. DAY
dialogues.text: SIBYLLA, now in loose Arab muslin, comes along the galler SERVANTS with her. She has her silver goblet. SIBYLLA dri and looks at Balian. No dialog necessary. She goes to the pool, steps barefoot into it, and washes. Her wrists. Bal looks around at the desert. Sibylla bends forward as a servant pours water over her hair. She moves forward thro the water, the muslin wet, and hands Balian her cup. She wrings the end of her muslin wrap, and washes the dust fr BalianвЂ™s face. He catches her wrist, meaning: donвЂ™t. are watching.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: (smiling, and continuing to wash his face) This isnвЂ™t adultery, itвЂ™s washing. BALIAN looks not so much embarrassed, as embarrassed at b embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But if it were adultery, which (she wipes his face) it isnвЂ™t, the Commandments are not for persons in our positions. They are for others.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: (gruffly, remembering that he ought to think about this) Did they give you something to eat?

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: (a tucked smiles as she kicks through the pool) Yes. They вЂњgave me something to eatвЂќ. Out of shot, with Balian staring after her. Picked up, sh wades into the green, saline, pool, under the palms, hold up her dress. SheвЂ™s no princess, just a girl kicking th the water. She stops and looks into the desert. Rippling wind. Beyond palms, mirages. SIBYLLA cocks her head, wait to hear if Balian comes up behind her. He has not. She looks around and sees: BALIAN is gone. She smiles, and kicks on through the wate  62.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE HOUSE AT IBELIN. AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: SIBYLLA watches from the roof terrace as SIBYLLAвЂ™S POV: Within a crowd of exultant peasants THE WATERWHEEL is lif (fairly easily now) on its long axle and is fitted into i frame above the new well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BALIAN working. BALIAN, intense, turns the wheel by raw force, and watches...buckets come up, full of water. he n and lets the wheel drop. MONTAGE details of the gearing b assembled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIBYLLA, watching Balian, leaning against the stones, see to have come to some decision. Terrible heat.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: I think we are looking at the one man in the world who is not like another. The Maidservant lays a damp cloth across her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MAIDSERVANT
dialogues.text: On the contrary, he is common, my lady. Your husband Guy is a man. SIBYLLA laughs, the cloth over her eyes. She looks like Justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE the completion of the waterwheel, and its operati Water gushes through pipes into troughs into ditches, and paddies begin to flood, the soil darkening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Among his dancing subjects, and grinning men-at-arms (ALM even essays to slap his back), BALIAN is lost in thought of...as he looks back at his house...Sibylla, who stands the roof, watching.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE GREAT ROOM AT IBELIN. EVENING
dialogues.text: BALIAN is drawing. SIBYLLA watches him from behind a gauz curtain. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Balian dips his pen in ink. Draws, blots, draws. SIBYLLA comes behind Balian and looks over his shoulder. BALIAN becomes aware of her.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: You have a guest. BALIAN looks at her boldly.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: I am aware. That I have a guest. SIBYLLA lowers her eyes and changes the subject.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: Is this the...вЂќworkвЂќ...you did in France? What I saw today?

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: In my work in France the only thing that was mine was the quality. She looks at his drawings.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: These are the walls of Jerusalem. You have changed the David Gate.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Yes. It ought to be changed. It is...impractical.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: Eleven hundred and fifty years ago, Jesus Christ rode through it on a donkey. (raises palms drolly) In Jerusalem, as it was, it shall be. Jerusalem is not about what is practical. To say...the least. BALIAN smiles. He likes this woman. Sibylla and Balian lo at each other. Neither are smiling now. At the moment of intolerable sexual tension, a bell rings at the end of th room. BALIAN looks and sees SIBYLLAвЂ™S SERVANTS (includi scandalized MAIDSERVANT) laying out a meal. He moves with Sibylla towards the low table. They sit on cushions. A fi burns at the end of the room. Sibylla eats, with knife an fingers, licking her fingers, drinking wine. (No silverwa doesnвЂ™t mean no manners). Sibylla looks up and sees Bal staring at her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: It seems years since I have seens a woman eat.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: The Hospitaler told me what occurred in France. BALIAN looks up.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (tearing flat bread) Had he not told me, I would have had him tortured. (they both laugh, but then seriously: ) You loved her.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Yes. (a beat) I did. Very much. She was melancholy. I loved her. Quietly, they eat. The drapes blow, the candles flare.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: I watches you today. You have been given a patch of dust and it almost seems you will build a new Jerusalem here.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: It is my house. What would I be if I did not make it better? Sibylla plays with her glass. She looks carefully at Bali And then, as if caught staring, looks chaotically down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIBYLLA and BALIAN are walking. As BALIAN looks at her, t is a MUSLIM CALL TO PRAYER...the last of the day.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: (off the prayer) They try to be one: one heart, one morality. One passion. They try to do without our infinite complications. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (a beat) Their prophet says вЂњsubmitвЂќ. Jesus said вЂњdecideвЂќ. On вЂњdecideвЂќ she looks directly at Balian, and is quit clearly in love with him.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to change the subject) Do you pray?

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: I pray that I may be equal to what has been asked of me. To what has been given me.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: We all pray that at first. But who stays content when others have more?

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: (smiles) I was content, with what you would call nothing. I may be content again. Here. He looks out over the praying Ibelin Muslims. All in submission to God, bowing in unison.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They submit...we must decide. They have it easier. (gently) You did not decide on Guy.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: (unhappily, firmly) My first husband was chosen by my father. I cannot complain, since my son was the result, but that is retrospection. My first husband died before his son was born.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: I have seen your son.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: He is not strong. And he will be the king. (she thinks sadly about her son, then presses on) Guy was chosen by my mother. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Kingdom needed new blood. My mother took what was available at the time. (near tears and wanting to be alone) I have not decided very much in my days. One learns not to want. They submit to God. I submit to the Kingdom of Jerusalem. Good night.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Good night. SIBYLLA goes along the gallery. BALIAN watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE FIELDS. MORNING
dialogues.text: BALIAN dismounts and, boots in the furrowed dry earth, wa his horse respectfully past the praising MUSLIMS. Squinti against the late sun. A note of paradise. MUSLIMS pray, J and CHRISTIANS work together in the fields. Ibelin is a microcosm of the kingвЂ™s Jersualem--the better world.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE GALLERY. DAY
dialogues.text: SIBYLLA is sitting in an archway, knees up, looking out a the water. BALIAN come in, dusty. Brass chimes turn and tinkle in th wind.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: I could stay here...perhaps not forever... but a little while longer.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: This house is yours.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: (staring into the light) Why am I here? BALIAN sits down beside her.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: I know that Ibelin is not on the way to Cana. Sibylla smiles. Her eyes luminous.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: What else do you know, my lord? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: I know that your are a princess and that I am no lord. Nor do I wish to be.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: You are a knight.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Not proved. Sibylla looks up at Balian.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: I do not stay on here with you because I am bored, or wicked. I am here because... in the East... one may decide... (a beat) ...-because in the East between one person and another there is only light. BALIAN raises her face and kisses her. He carries against a pillar. INT. THE ROOFTOP вЂњBEDROOMвЂќ AT IBELIN. NIGHT 67. her back SIBYLLA, sitting in the bed, takes one by one the rings f her hennaed hands.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: This is from France, which I have not seen...I have never been to France...This for my brother...This to remind us of death...This I bought the day I saw you...

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: You lie. SIBYLLA laughs, admitting it, gets up on her knees, puts ring on a chain she has take from around her neck and put around his neck and kisses him. Leaving Balian staring af her she goes to the window, wrapped in silk, and takes up broken pomegranate from the table. With a silver in she e the seeds. BALIAN goes and takes the in from her, and set the POMERGRANATE down. Sibylla looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: But IвЂ™m hungry. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He kisses her. BalianвЂ™s been out of the game for a whil carries her back to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE DESERT. DAWN
dialogues.text: CAMELS laden with dyed goods move along, bells tinkling. Three of the merchantвЂ™s daughters ride in camel howdahs A MUSLIM TRADING CARAVAN moves across the wide desert. Tw hundred camels. it has with it a small force of calvary, riding in a file. A HILLTOP. TWO RIDERS CREST IT. GUY and REYNALD sit their horses and stare towards the Muslims. They are at the head of a little over 50 knights including fanatical TEMPLARS. Destriers restless. Ready a the men are to fight.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: (near-sighted) Do you see them?

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: (smoothly) How could I? I am not here. (a beat) This caravan is armed, Reynald. A CRY FROM BELOW as they are spotted. The MUSLIM FORCE spreads out, arches on horseback, forming a line between Crusaders and the now hastening caravan. The TEMPLAR MAST rides up beside them. Bloodthirsty.

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLAR MASTER
dialogues.text: God wills it. REYNALD draws his sword. A ride detaches and streaks away across the desert. GUY notices.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: A rider got away.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: (unconcerned) ItвЂ™s a broad desert. Nothing will of it. Nothing... (laughs ) or the apocalypse. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: I prefer to not be hanged before my wife is queen.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: Does that make you king? I have never been sure.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Close enough.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: (riding along the ridge) DonвЂ™t worry. Who but Reynald? they will say. ItвЂ™s always me! (belches ) They will believe it at Jerusalem, I assure you. And Damascus. You were at Nazareth, praying.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: (drawing sword) You're a clever man.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: On the other hand, how long can the leper last? Not long. If the war is to be now or later I would have it now. GUY nods. HeвЂ™s thinking that as well.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Now. 69. The KNIGHTS charge. Reverse it. The CAMELS and people are running. Men grabbing weapons of every kind. The heavy knights smash through the defenders, killing everyone the come near. People trying to surrender are killed. We TEMPLARS killing with particular savagery. Leave the the dust, the knights murdering, the camels running, and silver spilling...ItвЂ™s over almost at once. GUY, with blood, wheels his horse. see the fight in silks covered REYNALD rides up to: The MUSLIM GRANDEE. The man he paid at the palace.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: You. He splits him in half.  70.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE ROOFTOP BEDROOM AT IBELIN. DAWN
dialogues.text: Wind is rising. BALIAN covers Sibylla with more blankets. stares hauntedly, hollowly. She has been crying. Stares o

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Why do you cry?

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: Because I go in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Stay.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: I have a dying brother, and a child who will be king. CLOSE ON BALIAN, CONSIDERING THIS ENORMOUS FACT.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As for us, the world will decide. The world always decides.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. COURTYARD AT IBELIN. DAY
dialogues.text: A dust storm rising. Wind in the palms. SibyllaвЂ™s lance mounted. BALIAN helps Sibylla into the saddle. They are awkward, observed, infinitely sad. As she bitterly turns her horse there is a commotion OS. People pointing. BALIAN leaves Sibylla and moves through the crowd to see: BALIANвЂ™S POV: A MUSLIM in a blood-stained gown is stumbling through the palms, crying for water, for help BALIAN stares as his people rush forward and we go to:

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE THRONE ROOM. JERUSALEM. DAY
dialogues.text: An assembly of the powers of the land. Set up like the Ho of Commons, with Templars and GuyвЂ™s party on one side, Hospitalers and loyalists on the other. The king wearing mask of silver, looking at GUY and TIBERIAS, who stand be him.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Maybe Reynald did attack a caravan. But what of it? War is inevitable. Peace...unnatural. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLAR MASTER
dialogues.text: (like a man speaking in tongues ) It was no caravan. It was an army headed for Bethlehem to desecrate the birthplace of Our Lord.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Reynald, with the Templars, I am sure--

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLARS
dialogues.text: Lie! Lie!

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: ..-have broken the kingвЂ™s pledge of peace. Saladin will come into this kingdom...

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Tiberias knows more than a Christian should about SaladinвЂ™s intentions. Uproar among the BARONS. TIBERIAS goes close to GUY.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: That you love the Saracens. A close moment. TIBERAIS very close to Guy.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: That I would rather live with people than kill them is certainly why you are alive.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: That sort of Christianity has its uses. I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: (to court) We cannot have war with Saladin. We will not win it. And, yes, we do not want it.

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLARS
dialogues.text: Blashpemy, blasphemy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLAR MASTER
dialogues.text: Blasphemy. An army of Jesus Christ which bears his holy cross cannot be beaten. Does the Count of Tiberias suggest that it could be? An uproar among the divided parties.

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLAR MASTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There must be war. God wills it.

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLARS
dialogues.text: God wills it. God wills it. God wills it.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: (roaring at the whole court) Then pray Jerusalem that God will win it, for in the end we shall not. The hall falls silent. A MESSENGER has entered. He moves forward, and speaks to the King. The King raises his mask face.

dialogues.speaker: THE KING
dialogues.text: Saladin has crossed the Jordan. With two hundred thousand men.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: He will go first for Kerak. The king starts to rise.

dialogues.speaker: THE KING
dialogues.text: Assemble the Army.

dialogues.speaker: HYSICIAN
dialogues.text: Your majesty...If you travel you will die. GUY, overhearing this, looks pleased.

dialogues.speaker: THE KING
dialogues.text: Assemble the Army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dust is blowing through the tangled corpses of men and horses. BALIANвЂ™S MEN pick through the wreckage. BALIAN вЂњsolvingвЂќ the fight. What horses came from which dire BALIAN dismounts and examines a dead horse. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: (examining it) ThatвЂ™s not a wound. The brand is cut off.

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC
dialogues.text: Reynald did this. His castle of Kerak is ten leagues. Fifteen... A cry OS: A SOLDIER is driving off vultures.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: The Christian bodies hid. Here. In a natural ditch, hastily covered, stripped European bodies, half-buried. The sand blows across them. As BALIA stares down: SIBYLLA rides up behind him and stares equably at the bod What sort of woman is this? A woman of her time. JACKALS loping towards the dead.

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC
dialogues.text: We must send a rider to the King. Unless my lady will take the news to Jerusalem.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: No. I am staying with you.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: (holding her bridle) I am going to Kerak. Reynald did this.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: Not alone, I think. Not alone. ON SOUND: A BELL CLANGING ALARM.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE VALLEY OF KERAK. DAY
dialogues.text: A LINE OF REFUGEES are streaming towards the castle, thro a rubbly village being evacuated in haste. People loading mules, camels. Some simply running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BALIAN crests the hill, mounted, followed by the entire garrison of Ibelin (50 mounted men). In the distance down valley: dust. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC
dialogues.text: The calvary will come up the valley to close Reynald in, and the siege army will come behind it. BALIAN looks at the refugees straggling across the desert he does he sees: MUSLIM HORSE are coming up the valley. O parties of calvary appear in all directions. He turns to SIBYLLA.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: Princesses are not killed. Somewhere it is written down.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Go into the fortress. Now. SIBYLLA is a woman of her time: she too has seen the cava in every direction: nods. She kisses BALIAN, looks him in eye, and then gallops off, her lancers with her. BALIAN rides a little forward, staring. MOTHERS with chil running through the dust.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. KERAK. DAY
dialogues.text: KERAKвЂ™S BELL is continuing to peal alarm as SIBYLLA and TURCOPOLES flash up through the gates.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: Visitors! REYNALD, wearing a festive gown, and eating an orange, st indifferently at the desert. His personal Priest and confessor (a ragged, long suffering cleric) is with him. AT-ARMS are manning the walls. REYNALD (CONTвЂ™D) (grabs the priest, to use him as вЂњbinocularsвЂќ ) How many? REYNALDвЂ™S PRIEST I canвЂ™t see yet. Only a dust cloud...

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: (hands his goblet to the priest and pisses against a buttress) I serve God. That is what I do. If God tells me to raid Mecca then by God I raid Mecca. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That is the way things are done. And now itвЂ™s all this. Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSLIM HORSE move from a canter to a gallop. Sweeping up valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the first of the REFUGEES making it through the ga SIBYLLA stands on the ramparts, looking out.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: I wish I were fifty again or that you drank liquor. What do you look at?

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: Knights.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: (squints) What knights?

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE VALLEY NEARER THE CASTLE. MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: We see the streaming refugees, driving cattle, and heavy the women and children. Into the shot, BALIAN and knights They turn to face the oncoming Muslim cavalry, that rolli wall of dust. They walk forward through the refugees movi in the other direction. A RIDER comes up.

dialogues.speaker: RIDER
dialogues.text: My lord prays you bring your knights into Kerak. BALIAN completely ignores him. The RIDER is mystified. Bu twigs it: Balian is going to delay the Muslim cavalry.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: (staring towards Muslims) If we go into the castle, those people will die.

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC
dialogues.text: We cannot attack that force and live. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: There must be a lie about how many Saracens one of us is worth in battle.

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC
dialogues.text: The commonest is ten.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Are you with me? ALMARIC nods and makes the sign of the cross. The KNIGHTS SERGEANTS cross themselves as well. BALIAN rides slowly forward at the head of his men.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE BATTLEMENTS OF KERKA. LATER
dialogues.text: REYNALD, now being helped into his armor, stares towards south, still squinting and using the PRIEST as his вЂњbinocularsвЂќ.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: They mean to charge that? They are better men than me. Not quite so bright, but better men than me. (to Sibylla) You know this fellow. Why is he doing this?

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: Because he is a knight, Reynald.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: Hmmn. (turning away indifferently) Selah. (A Hebrew word from the Psalms, meaning, as he says it, вЂњSo be itвЂќ.) SIBYLLA, unexpectedly, crosses herself, and watches for t outcome.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE VALLEY OF KERAK. DAY
dialogues.text: BALIAN advances with his thin line of heavy cavalry, now fully interposed between the Muslims and the refugees. Th Muslims are racing, but in contrast to them (going back t BALIAN) we should not mistake how very dangerous the heav knights are. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BALIAN spurs his horse up to a canter, and then as his me catch up, and, taking the вЂњhigh guardвЂќ (none of the k now using reins: the destriers know exactly what to do) gallops towards the Muslim force. The forces collide. The knights drive deep all across the front, killing, unhorsi scores of MUSLIMS, completely destroying the impetus of t Muslim cavalry. DESTRIERS smash down Arab horses. A KNIGH lanced off his horse. ARABS, in the hundreds, are hacked of the saddle. Arrows miss their targets. Men roll on the ground in the melee. The IBELIN MEN are grotesquely outnumbered but the have stopped the Muslim advance--for the moment.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. KERAK. DAY
dialogues.text: REFUGEES stream in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inevitable end is near: There are too many Muslims. IBELIN MEN go down and are run down by horses or killed o seized by dismounted men. BALIAN wheels in the melee, killing. His HORSE is hamstri (we see the hatchet that does it), and he goes down. Immediately he is overwhelmed by Arabs, disarmed, beaten, dragged. Horses, whirling dust, screaming men. BALIAN is dragged, forced to his knees. He sees: ALMARIC, with a head wound, and some other of his men, kneeling, all threatened by yelling Muslims. BALIAN close his eyes, preparing to accept death, and lowers his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIBYLLA turns away from what seems to be the imminent execution of Balian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FINE BOOTS come forward through the dust. A SCIMITAR is drawn. BALIAN looks up and sees: the SCIMITAR raised as i behead him. He lowers his eyes and head. The sword impact ON HIS SHOULDER. The flat of it quivers there and is withdrawn. BALIAN looks up and sees: IMAD. The commander of SaladinвЂ™s cavalry. In beautiful Damascus armor, smiling at him. MUSLIMS stare. Do they ki these men? Do they not? Imad helps Balian to his feet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: You were not that manвЂ™s servant.

dialogues.speaker: IMAD
dialogues.text: No. A MUSLIM hands BALIAN a waterskin. ALMARIC canвЂ™t believ is happening. The MUSLIMS draw back, murmuring. BALIAN no and drinks, then, with ImadвЂ™s nodded permission, takes water to a wounded man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PRIEST is watching.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: They are letting them live.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: (indifferent, swigs wine) Sometimes they are chivalrous. They learned it from us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IMAD and BALIAN.

dialogues.speaker: IMAD
dialogues.text: You may go into Kerak, but you will die there. My master is here. BALIAN looks past IMAD to higher ground (to one side of t valley of Kerak) and sees...the arrival of SALADINвЂ™S AR enormous line of men, mounted and unmounted, in perfect order, each section with its banner.

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC
dialogues.text: And ours, my lord. IMAD looks in the other direction. Far, far off he sees t glint of steel in dust. IMAD walks apart, staring and get onto hi horse to see better.

dialogues.speaker: IMAD
dialogues.text: Tell my lord Saladin that Jerusalem is come. THE ARMY OF THE KINGDOM OF JERUSALEM. The KING rides in his litter alongside THE HOLY CROSS, covered with gold and jewels, passes through the streamin dust. 500 knights are marching towards the relief of Kera (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They are flanked by and protected by 5,000 SPEARMEN and CROSSBOWMEN. Essentially the army is a moving square, tremendously disciplined. GUY is with the army. IMAD stares through the dust. A man breaks away from the Muslim line and rides up beside him. A small, slight, fig unarmored, in simple clothing. He scrutinizes Balian, his bloody men, then Imad.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: Pull back your cavalry. As HORNS blow and the Muslims retire, leaving Balian and wounded, winded, men in the valley with a perfect view of events... THE ARMY OF JERUSALEM does an "evolution" and in one move it is transformed into a fighting line, facing the Muslim Army, about a quarter mile away. Out of the dust rides... BALIANвЂ™S POV: THE KING. THE KING, a brilliant horseman, is using every ounce of strength he still possesses to not only stay in the saddl but look as if he is still a living man, when in fact he essentially, already a dead one. He rides in front of his army, and raises his palm as he arrives before Saladin. SALADIN rides forward himself, so that they are very clos

dialogues.speaker: THE KING
dialogues.text: I pray you retire unharmed to Damascus. SALADIN moves forward, looking closely at the dying king. knows how much effort this has cost the man.

dialogues.speaker: THE KING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Reynald of Chatillon will be punished. I swear it. Withdraw, or we all die here. SALADIN looks at the Army of Jerusalem. Then at the king.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: I will send you my physicians. The KING lowers his head but only for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: THE KING
dialogues.text: Do we have terms? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: We have terms. The masked KING rides back to his army.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. KERAK. LATER
dialogues.text: THE ARAB FORCE PARTS. BALIAN and his surviving men, relea to cheers from the battlements, ride out towards the gate the castle, which are opened.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE COURTYARD AT KERAK. MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: BALIAN and his men stagger in, acclaimed by the peasants have saved. Through the crowd comes Reynald.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: You would have given me more mouths the feed and more shit to throw over the wall. You have a great deal to learn about sieges. REYNALD claps him on the arm. REYNALD (CONTвЂ™D) (whispering) But that was magnificent. BALIAN, looking up, sees SIBYLLA. She stands in an archwa Smiling down. BALIAN starts for Sibylla. At that moment...THE KING and party, including TIBERIAS and GUY, gallops through the ga of KERAK. Unable to go to Sibylla through the crowd, BALIAN pulls h ring on its chain from the throat of his armor, and kisse it. SIBYLLA nods. REYNALD knows heвЂ™s in for it. He drinks the last of the THE KING gets painfully from the saddle. The ride has kil him: has taken near the last of his strength. The King, walking to Reynald, dragging one leg, removes his turban. drops it on the ground. He walks towards Reynald, and tak off his mask. We do not see The KingвЂ™s destroyed face. Reynald does.

dialogues.speaker: THE KING
dialogues.text: I am Jerusalem. (walks forward, unwrapping one of his hands) (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE KING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Will you give me the kiss of peace, Reynald? The King holds out a ruined hand, with a ring on what rem of a finger. REYNALD kisses the hand. The King beats him a stick. Again, again, again, as GUY watches--terrified that Reyna might squeal. Guy looks up and sees: SIBYLLA. He follows her eyeline to: BALIAN. And he knows. He unties a glove with his teeth. PHYSICIANS grab the king, who almost faints. The KING is helped to his litter. The KING reaches out a hand to SIBYLLA...who recoils from him The KING, a tear falling, closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: (to TIBERIAS) What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: A dead man. Reynald of Chatillon, you are arrested and condemned. The KING is laid into his litter. A draught of medicine i poured into the mouthhole of the mask. The king gestures BALIAN.

dialogues.speaker: THE KING
dialogues.text: (gently, almost dreamy) If you continue as you are I shall make you Marshal of Jerusalem. What do you think of that? Before Balian can respond, the KINGвЂ™S LITTER is carried TIBERIAS is beside BALIAN.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: When a man says something on the edge of sleep one may discard it. When a king says it, it will happen. Mark you. BALIAN and TIBERIAS lock eyes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do not return to Ibelin. I need you in Jerusalem. SIBYLLA cannot join Balian in public; but she looks at hi GUY observes this. SIBYLLA, noticing her husband, looks a GUY expressionlessly, and retires into an archway and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: A KNIGHT
dialogues.text: (still mounted, moving through the crowd) GodfreyвЂ™s son charged ten thousand with a hundred men.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Did he... BALIAN is mobbed...by GUYвЂ™S MEN as much as anybody. TIB watches shrewdly as the shy BALIANвЂ™s popularity with th troops becomes more than obvious. INT. SALADINвЂ™S TENT ON THE ROAD TO DAMASCUS. NIGHT SALADIN saturnine, watchful, delicate with his food, is dining with IMAD and a still-astonished MULLAH.

dialogues.speaker: MULLAH
dialogues.text: The battle must come. You have promised to drive the Christians into the sea. You have not done so. SALADIN makes no response. He sips tea, staring into flam

dialogues.speaker: MULLAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why did we retire? God could not favor him! God alone determines the results of battles.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: The results of battles are determined by God. But also by preparation, numbers, the absence of disease, and the availability of water. (kindly) One cannot maintain a siege with the enemy behind. The MULLAH stares: heresy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How many battles did God win for the Muslims before I came? (a courtly pause) Before, that is, God determined that I should come.

dialogues.speaker: MULLAH
dialogues.text: Few enough. (thinks about the reason) That is because we were sinful.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: It is because you were unprepared.

dialogues.speaker: MULLAH
dialogues.text: If you think tha way you shall not be king for long.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: (drily) When I am not king I quake for Islam. (he takes the MullahвЂ™s hands) Thank you for your visit.

dialogues.speaker: MULLAH
dialogues.text: (not leaving) You promised to return Jerusalem. SALADIN nods. The MULLAH goes. SALADIN stares into flame.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: (softly) If I do not deliver war, I have no peace.

dialogues.speaker: IMAD
dialogues.text: The king of Jerusalem will die soon. When he is dead, the boy will be king, and have no control of the kingdom. The Christians will make the war you need. SALADIN nods, frustrated, condemned. Neither man is happy with the realpolitik. OS the sounds of the camp, and pray

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The domed city is under a dust-storm. Heavy wind. We hear wind-torn churchbells and together with them the Muslims to prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOY KING is riding around a garden on his SIBYLLA watching, careworn, with love. BELLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind is blowing dust in the faces of spitting 84. pony, laughing. workmen who are levering a great stone up a ramp. BALIAN and ALMARIC walk cloaked, supervising the works. TWO CLOAKED MEN go past, salaaming to the embarrassed Balian. A burkahed woman giv him an orange from her basket: A memory of Godfrey. He smiles. Climbs up the wall. GREAT PIPES (for Greek Fire) being swayed up. BALIAN watches, supervising.

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC
dialogues.text: My lord?

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: (still uncomfortable with the вЂњmy lordвЂќ business) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC
dialogues.text: It is enough that you ask men-at- arms to push stones, and dig. It is worse to ask them to do it all day and night.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: We have a dying king. We need strong walls. As for work, I want every man at arms to learn a trde.

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC
dialogues.text: A trade?

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: A trade. Shoemaker. Tanner. Carpenter. Joiner. Baker. Blacksmith. This strikes Almaric as unreasonable.

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC
dialogues.text: It is beneath their condition.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: The first man to bring me a respectable pair of shoes I will make a knight. Smiles. Tosses Almaric the orange. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC
dialogues.text: (rationalizing) Jesus was a tradesman, of course. Nothing could be more noble. Balian turns and sees: GUY at the head of his troops. A G LINE OF KNIGHTS AND MEN AT ARMS is parading through the g Guy very much at their head, coming in from a brief patro It is also a show of force in the city. Fascistic, powerf An image of GuyвЂ™s power in the Kingdom. BALIAN, windblo the wall with his own dusty, hard-working men at arms, an stares down, locking eyes with GUY, as the knights stream past.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALLWAY IN THE CASTLE. LATER
dialogues.text: GUY watches over a cup of wine as PHYSICIANS go into the KingвЂ™s rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REYNALD is like a snarling lion in the dungeon.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: (echoing) I am Reynald of Chatillon. I am Reynald of Chatillon! INT. THE KINGвЂ™S CHAMBERS. CONTINUOUS A PILLAR CANDLE is burning. The king, breathing laborious is washed by his silent physicians. INCENSE smokes in cen hanging all around the room.

dialogues.speaker: PATRIARCH
dialogues.text: The things we have left undone plague us as death comes. That is why to the dying there is no comfort but the Lord. The MASK turns to the side and the kings haunted eyes gli at: THE CHESSBOARD.

dialogues.speaker: THE KING
dialogues.text: We must announced the boy as my successor. Go to Tiberias and tell him to come. The PATRIARCH nods.

dialogues.speaker: THE KING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Leave me.  86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PATRIARCH, coming out, nods at GUY. GUY sips wine, an moves along the hall. He goes to the door of SibyllaвЂ™s He hesitates, and then kicks in the door. INT. SIBYLLAвЂ™S ROOMS. CONTINUOUS The MAIDSERVANT stands in shock. She retreats a little.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Where is my wife? The MAIDSERVANT retreats. GUY smiles, and goes after her.

dialogues.speaker: GUY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You sometimes dream you are my wife. Le us pretend you are my wife. The MAIDSERVANT simpers, ready for it. He rummages on a t and puts a little tiara crookedly on the poor girlвЂ™s he INT. BALIANвЂ™S HOUSE, BEDROOM. NIGHT A CANDLE lighted from a splinter of wood reveals: SIBYLLA She is bare-shouldered, her hair down, but careworn.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: We cannot meet in the city.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Then we will leave it. SIBYLLA looks at him over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: Balian...My brother is dying. My son will be King and I his regent. I must rule for my son. Not just in Jerusalem, but Acre, Ascalon, Beirut... CLOSE ON Balian as the candles gutter. He is afraid of wh heвЂ™s opened up.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: And Guy? CLOSE ON SIBYLLA, thinking.  87. INT. SIBYLLAвЂ™S ROOMS. LATER Torchbearers comes in, GUARDS, and then Sibylla, cloaked. sees first...her boy playing with LEAD SOLDIERS...and the with a shock, GUY sitting in a chair. A bit worn out. Hol the handle of a dagger.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: These rooms are not yours.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: One day I will be the husband I was...commissioned to be.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: And perhaps not. GUY knows that she refers to Bailian. He smiles thinly, e down.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Your lover has a hundred knights and the love of the king. I, the largest force in the Kingdom...the support of the Templars...and I can do without...the other. But your love... SIBYLLA knocks away his hand. Her GUARDS are standing the

dialogues.speaker: GUY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Soon, we will come to an understanding. You need my knights. Or your sonвЂ™s rule will be bloody and brief. He leaves the torchlight and the room. SIBYLLA takes of h cloak, face white.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE DUNGEON. LATER
dialogues.text: REYNALD, hair tangled, in soiled linen, is eating porridg with his fingers. He stops to yell his name. The doors op GUY. Still dusty from riding.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: In the desert, I had a thought. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: That is what the desert is for. Did you come to kill me for giving your name? Because I havenвЂ™t. And won't.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Be as much at peace as you can in here. You will not be here long.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: And you? Do you think that the king really wants you at the head of the army when his is gone? Do you? GUY leans against the wall, thinking. REYNALD (CONTвЂ™D) Do you think your wife does?

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: I have a problem.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: I saw him at Kerak. Celebrated.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Precisely.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: You must beware of a popular man. As do, I think, the Templars.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Precisely. INT. THE KINGвЂ™S CHAMBERS. LATER BALIAN looks down at the dying king.

dialogues.speaker: THE KING
dialogues.text: It is time to conclude my affairs. (a beat) You are the Marshal of Jerusalem. (BALIAN looks up) And you are a peer of this kingdom. Do you know what that means? BALIAN shakes his head вЂњnoвЂќ. TIBERIAS watches gravely

dialogues.speaker: THE KING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No one can rule a kingdom who cannot lead troops in battle. Tiberias will not live forever. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The KING sits up, stands, and under his own power goes to chair.

dialogues.speaker: THE KING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I cannot die with there being a chance of Guy taking power through my sister. He will make war against the Muslims, who are only too ready to take this Kingdom. Will you protect my nephew when he is king?

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: THE KING
dialogues.text: Would you marry Sibylla were she free? BALIAN stares at the floor for a long time. He has been offered his desires. He finally looks up.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: And Guy?

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: He will be executed on the instant you say yes. With all of his knights who do not swear to you. BALIAN must now give away the woman he loves.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: I cannot be the cause of that.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: You are not in your forge anymore, boy. Do it. The KING raises his hand for silence. TIBERIAS, exasperat leaves the room. THE KING watches BALIAN.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: A king may move a man, you said. But the soul, you said, is the manвЂ™s. The KING (we can see it through the mouth-hole) smiles.

dialogues.speaker: THE KING
dialogues.text: ~..Yes.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: You have my love. And my answer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BALIAN takes the wrapped hands and bows. INT. THE HALL OUTSIDE THE KINGвЂ™S ROOMS. MOMENTS LATER TIBERIAS leans against the wall. BALIAN comes out OS. All Tiberias as he realizes: Balian possibly isnвЂ™t going to it.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: (coming closer)

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: He has made me Marshal of Jerusalem. I will protect the kingdom, and the new king. To the rest, I have said no.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: I understand. I do. But if you do not marry Sibylla--

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: I will not kill a man in cold blood or for profit.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: (interrupts, pleading) Who is he that you save his life? HeвЂ™s a man who hates you, who has insulted you...I play Devil...but for the salvation of this kingdom. Compromise yourself. (Balian is backing away from him) Jerusalem does not need вЂњa perfect knightвЂќ. This is the world.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: No...it is his kingdom, and it is my life. And both are kingdoms of conscience, or nothing. BALIAN moves on. He sees: GUY. GUY (who has not heard the previous) stares at him hollowly.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: A hundred against ten thousand. Slow clapping from Guy. BALIAN gives the man whose life h has saved a long, long, look, and then continues on his w  gl. INT. THE COURTYARD AT BALIANвЂ™S HOUSE. CONTINUOUS Moonlight in the pool. BALIAN sits down and looks at the water. PALMS blow overhead, reminiscent of Ibelin. Horseв hooves, OS, and someone comes in behind Balian. BALIAN lo around. It is SIBYLLA, cloaked.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: I see a man who could be great, unless he chooses to be вЂњgoodвЂќ. If you do not join with me, I am left with Guy.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: You would see your husband dead.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: For Jerusalem. For my son. For love.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: What kind of вЂњloveвЂќ is that?

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: Who are you to refuse a king? You refuse my son.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: I refuse to do murder. Especially of a man who stands between me and what I want. (Sibylla is shaken) And Jerusalem. Look into your heart. Do you have any idea of Jerusalem except that it is yours?

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: (a long pause, and an honest answer) It is mine. My grandfather took Jerusalem in blood. I will keep it in the same way, or any way I can, for my family, for my son. I am what I am. I offer you that, and the world...you say no.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Do you think I am Guy? That I would sell my sould for вЂњthe worldвЂќ, or even you? Do you think that I am a...thing...that can be used? SIBYLLA looks up at him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: I think you are a man. And I think there will be a day when you wish you had done a little evil, to doa greater good. SIBYLLA exits. BALIAN stares after her. INT. SIBYLLAвЂ™S ROOMS. LATER PUSH through the rooms to find SIBYLLA. She crushes a ros stem and all, and the blood rills down her wrist.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. IBELIN. DAY
dialogues.text: THE WATERWHEEL TURNS, spilling water into a ditch which r off into the fields. BALIAN, covered with dust, looks at wheel turning. Then at the crops. IBELIN KIDS are staring him. He wander out of shot. INT. SIBYLLAвЂ™S ROOMS. NIGHT SIBYLLA is showing her son a GLOBE of the world.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: That is England, where Richard is King. And here is France. We have lands there. Very green.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Will I ever see France?

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: But you must be king. Here.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Why? She looks sad and guilty. A sound. SIBYLLA looks at: TIBERIAS. She stands.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: The king wants you. He needs you.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: I cannot bear to look at him. He knows this. It does not mean I do not love him.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: (imploring her) Go. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sibylla nods. It is something she knew she must do anyway TIBERIAS stays looking at the boy for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: May God defend you. TIBERIAS goes out. The BOY plays with the candle flame. H touches it with one hand-- and draws the hand back, in pa He touches the flame with his other and (the fingers touc the flame OS) does not draw the hand back.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE KING'S DEATHCHAMBER. MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: The KING, wearing his mask, is breathing raggedly. SIBYLL approaches, down the long room. The KingвЂ™s PHYSICIANS b away. She kneels beside her brotherвЂ™s bed, as if at a c at a wake.

dialogues.speaker: THE KING
dialogues.text: Do you remember when I was a boy...

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: And when you defeated Saladin. You were sixteen... She cries.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have never not been beautiful. In every act. In every word.

dialogues.speaker: THE KING
dialogues.text: Remember me as I was.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: (in tears) I will. I do. The mask moves: a nod. SIBYLLA kisses the mask.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE HALLWAY. NIGHT
dialogues.text: GUY is standing outside as Sibylla comes out. He looks strangely more needy and in love than villainous. SIBYLLA looks at him evenly.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: If my son has your knights, you have a wife.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Unless I am made head of the Army we have no bargain. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SIBYLLA nods and moves on. INT. THE KINGвЂ™S DEATHCHAMBER. TWILIGHT Move through the columned room. THE KING IS DEAD AND LIES STATE. SIBYLLA kneels at the end of the room. She crosses hersel and stands to leave, but then as if in a dream moves towa the biered, masked, body. She reaches out trembling finge and removes the mask. Here for the first time we see what leprosy has done to the king, her brother. She stumbles b and drops the MASK on the stones. Then, as she looks up, is the Sibylla who will do what must be done. Whatever it be.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: Long live the King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BELLS are tolling, funereally. PEOPLE are wailing in mourning, throwing dust on themselves. A few brighter lig might actually be packing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torchlight. All the nobles of the kingdom. The BOY is giv scepter and orb, and crowned by the Patriarch. SIBYLLA is her knees, watching, GUY beside her. The Patriarch turns toward them.

dialogues.speaker: PATRIARCH
dialogues.text: Do you swear before God to be his true regents in peace and war. SIBYLLA and GUY nod, swearing, and are anointed with oil. is given a baton signifying command of the Army. He looks it. Then up.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. WHITE DESERT. DAY
dialogues.text: A CREOSOTE BUSH. A stone falls near it. Another. The thir stone throws a spark, and the bush explodes into flame: t burning bush of Moses.

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITALER, (OS)
dialogues.text: I do not hear a voice.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Nor I. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As the HOSPITALER walks his horse follows him, almost magically.

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITALER
dialogues.text: Do you love her? BALIAN nods. HOSPITALER (CONTвЂ™D) You've followed your conscience. Your heart will mend. Balian stares into the light. HOSPITALER (CONTвЂ™D) You are Marshal of Jerusalem now. Your duty is with the people of the city. No matter who is on the throne. BALIAN nods. The HOSPITALER mounts. HOSPITALER (CONTвЂ™D) I go to pray.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITALER
dialogues.text: For the strength to endure what is to come.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: The Muslims will come when he is dead.

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITALER
dialogues.text: The reckoning is to come for what was done a hundred years before. The Muslims will never forget. Nor should they. The HOSPITALER wanders away into a mirage.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. A GARDEN. DAY
dialogues.text: A TURBANED SERVANT is running, leading the BOYвЂ™S PONY. BOY, his dress now velvet, regal, bounces happily in the saddle. SIBYLLA walks with COUNCILORS.  96.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE THRONE ROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: The BOY sits at a large draped table, swinging his legs, bored. SIBYLLA, tired, finishes writing-- in Arabic!

dialogues.speaker: PATRIARCH
dialogues.text: My lady, are you sure this is wise, to show your intentions to Saladin. Better to let him wonder...

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: We keep my brotherвЂ™s peace. GUY, overhearing this, bored among the courtiers, rolls h eyes. The KEEPER OF THE SEAL is waiting, with wax hot in a vess of some sort. SIBYLLA puts the paper in front of the boy guides his clumsy hand to sign. DETAIL: вЂњBALDWIN V IERUUSALEMвЂќ SIBYLLA nods. The KEEP OF THE SEAL brings the smoking wax the paper and as he does it dribbles across the BOYвЂ™S H SIBYLLA notices that the BOY is staring out at the garden entranced, oblivious. She covers his hand with her handkerchief. But the PATRIARCH has seen. SIBYLLA, her вЂњmask of officeвЂќ in place. The JERUSALEM pressed into the wax.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The king is tired. I thank you all. INT. THE KINGвЂ™S ROOMS. NIGHT Amidst candles, the boy, lying on his back on a draped be is examined by MUSLIM PHYSICIANS in black as a servant distracts him with a monkey or a Punchinello puppet. SIBY leans against a wall, breathing sharply as if hyperventilating but holding herself together. She sees h son in the kingвЂ™s rooms, surrounded as the king was by physicians...she is wobbly...ashen-faced. A PHYSICIAN examines the boyвЂ™s hand (still with the remains of a bu it) and then moves to the feet. Gently he feels them. The sticks a pin into one. The BOY does not react. The PHYSIC looks up to SIBYLLA, who begins to tremble. The shadow of monkey or the puppet on the wall.  97. INT. SIBYLLAвЂ™S ROOMS. NIGHT SIBYLLA is writing, alone. State papers. TIBERIAS stands of the shadows. He and SIBYLLA stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: There is a rumor. SIBYLLA raises her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: Call it treason, and kill those who whisper it. (writes) Starting with the Patriarch.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: Does the boy have your brother's disease? SIBYLLA slowly nods. She stands, and TIBERIAS embraces he He has known her her entire life.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (hollowly) We must call it a lie. Condemn it outright. Show the boy as active...

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: As you did with my brother? With his reins tied to his hands? How long before he wears a mask? Will you have one made for him?

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: I am sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: To the Muslims he will deserve it. They will say he deserved it as they said of my brother... How did my boy deserve it? (a beat) Jerusalem is dead, Tiberias. TIBERIAS fears it is true enough.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No kingdom is worth my son alive in hell. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: (finally) No.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: I will go to hell instead.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE GARDEN. DAY
dialogues.text: A brilliant, luminous, day. The BOY is happily riding his pony, holding his LEAD KNIGHT. This time SIBYLLA is leadi him. She is stone-faced. She leads him towards a вЂњsumme houseвЂќ at the end of the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIBYLLA uncorks a bottle, and pours a cup. Her fingers do tremble. She holds it to the boy who smiles radiantly at mother on the best day of his life, and drinks.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The boyвЂ™s hand opens and the LEAD KNIGHT falls to the f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see: A KNIGHT. It resolves as BALIAN, riding along the road. He dismounts to drink at rocky stream. He wears mai but no helmet. He looks up and sees (coming down the trac a solitary tree): THREE TEMPLAR KNIGHTS, GuyвЂ™s assassin arrayed across the road. They are heavily armed, enigmati BALIAN mounts, and rides towards them. One rides slightly forward, with a lance. BALIAN lance, only an undrawn sword. lance, and charges BALIAN, no grips his shield. He has no The FIRST TEMPLAR lowers his time to draw a sword, takes the lance on his shield, shatters it. The TEMPLAR takes out a mace.
