The SECOND TEMPLAR rides do with sword raised. BALIAN swings the sword and hits the h in the teeth (which is how a man on foot deals with caval The horse spills its ride. BALIAN runs forward and kills SECOND TEMPLAR, and then as he tries to catch the First TemplarвЂ™s horse is cut across the back of the head by a blow. His hands slip from the leather. He staggers, ready fight. The remaining THIRD TEMPLAR rides at him. Horses r wildly around, raising dust. The remaining Templar, dismounted comes walking out of the dust, a MACE swinging

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Is this why you came to the Holy Land? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The TEMPLAR looks doubtful. BALIAN is aware of the blood is losing.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on. The MACE hums. BALIAN ducks, and bashes in at the manвЂ™s getting inside the mace. The men fight hand to hand. He crawls to the fallen man and after a close struggle (Bali is losing consciousness) crams his dagger into the eye. H lies across the body of the dead man, bleeding from the b of the head.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. JERUSALEM. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Torches flare on the battlements. BELLS gong and echo thr the deserted streets.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE DUNGEON. LATER
dialogues.text: The doors open. REYNALD looks up. GUY, stunned by developments, leans against the wall. He holds a sword wrapped in its belt. BELLS on sound.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: The boy is in heaven. (GUY leans against the wall, nods) Your wife has no more stone than anyone I have known. God protect her. I admire good. I just canвЂ™t do it.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: She is in the crypt and will not come out.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: Have the Templars removed your problem? GUY nods, hollowly. He gives REYNALD his (ReynaldвЂ™s) sw

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Give me a war, Reynald.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: That is what I do. GUY walks out leaving the prison door open. BELLS carry o into...  100.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE CHURCH OF THE HOLY SEPULCHER. DAY
dialogues.text: Torchlight. All the nobles of the kingdom. SIBYLLA, looki beautiful, drugged, is crowned by the Patriarch. She sits the throne. As the Patriarch backs away she looks aside a sees: GUYвЂ™S HAND on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE DESERT. DAY
dialogues.text: REYNALD, armor covered with blood, stands and surveys A SLAUGHTERED MUSLIM CARAVAN. Silks are being dragged from bundles. Purses are being cut from dead Saracens. REYNALD walks through the scene of slaughter. MUSLIM WOMEN are being stripped and raped. REYNALD walks if stunned and ashamed, but still he has done what he has done. REYNALD quire simply cannot help himself.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: I am what I am. Someone has to be. He goes up to a captured MUSLIM WOMAN and...Unveils her. swerve up.

dialogues.speaker: KNIGHT
dialogues.text: That is SaladinвЂ™s sister.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DAMASCUS. DAY
dialogues.text: A GREAT PUBLIC SQUARE, filled with tens and tens of thous of Muslim men. They are acclaiming SALADIN but using the words to praise God. SALADIN raises his palm and the ALLA louder. In a fury Saladin moves away from his balcony and into his palace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IMAD is looking at his master with a kind of fear.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: There will be no quarter.

dialogues.speaker: IMAD
dialogues.text: GodfreyвЂ™s son is lord defender. He is honest. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: If they do not surrender Jerusalem they die. SALADIN cuts his palm; and with a finger puts a streak of blood on his head.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE THRONE ROOM IN JERUSALEM. NIGHT
dialogues.text: GUY is drinking. Not looking very much like being King wa his best idea. He is listening to a SARACEN MESSENGER.

dialogues.speaker: SARACEN MESSENGER
dialogues.text: Where is ibn Barzin?

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Who is ibn Barzin?

dialogues.speaker: SARACEN MESSENGER
dialogues.text: It is our name for the son of Godfrey.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: You will speak to me.

dialogues.speaker: SARACEN MESSENGER
dialogues.text: The Sultan will not talk terms. He means to try the Kingdom in the greatest wager of battle yet seen in this land. The Sultan finds us divided. The Sultan says that Jerusalem has now a false king. The Sultan demands the surrender of Jerusalem.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Does he. The SARACEN MESSENGER nods.

dialogues.speaker: SARACEN MESSENGER
dialogues.text: What answer do you give to Saladin? GUY takes out his dagger.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: This. He kills the SARACEN MESSENGER, driving point through the underjaw and into the brain. He lets the body fall.

dialogues.speaker: GUY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Send the head to Damascus. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SIBYLLA in her mourning clothes stands shocked in the doorway, blinking. GUY looks up to her.

dialogues.speaker: GUY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (mocking her thoughts) вЂњWhat have I done?вЂќ The TEMPLARS and GUYвЂ™S MEN, by prearrangement, kill the PALACE GUARD and HOSPITALERS. GUY walks slowly up to his wife, grabs her face, and kisses her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: GUY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You've served your purpose. You poisoned the wrong one. TIBERIAS stepping forward is confronted by GuyвЂ™s PIKEME

dialogues.speaker: GUY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wonвЂ™t confine you. I leave you your power, your knights. You may try civil war. But then the Saracens would see us divided and come in. And so much for ChristвЂ™s kingdom. As they call it in other parts of the world. (a beat) I have the town, I have the palace, I have its guard, I have the Templars, I have the Patriarch, and I have the crown. ItвЂ™s done, Tiberias. I am Jerusalem. (moving away) Assemble the Army.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OUTSIDE THE WALLS OF JERUSALEM. DAY
dialogues.text: The full ARMY OF THE KINGDOM OF JERUSALEM is assembled. Enormous ranks of horsemen, each in their "order" before city walls. Ranks of FOOTSOLDIERS to left and right. TURCOPOLES riding around the fringe, raising dust. The BA OF THE HOLY CROSS flies near GUY'S TENT.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GUY'S RED TENT. DAY
dialogues.text: An open-sided affair, a full view of the camp. Horses of nobility of the kingdom held outside. GUY has arranged himself in a thronelike chair at the end of his council table. BARONS in attendance. A commotion outside. GUY goe the ten opening and we see: BALIAN, without armor, walks slowly in past the lines of mounted men at arms, who salute him. Commotion among the FOOTSOLDIERS are well. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GUY is too observed to reveal his thoughts on the appeara of Balian. He returns nervously to his chair. BALIAN ente the crowded tent. He looks for a long time at the Templar Master. He and Guy stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Now this assemblage of barons is... by some loose definition.. (looks up at Balian) complete. There are those among you who may disagree with our succession but it is war and I...am the king. (looks up nerbously) We march at once. What say this council?

dialogues.speaker: ALMOST ALL
dialogues.text: Aye.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: No. TIBERIAS looks up and smiles. GUY is not smiling.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: There are barons, and barons, my lords. This is a curious one.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: If you must have a war, this army must not move away from water.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: What he says is true. If you march in the head of this season, you will kill this army.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: You have a chance to hold the city. But if you move out against Saladin, this army will be destroyed and the city left defenseless.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: When I wish a blacksmith as my advisor in war I will let him know. You will not join this army. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Saladin wants you to come out. He is waiting for you to make that mistake. He knows his man. BALIAN goes out. Guy staring after him.

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLAR MASTER
dialogues.text: We should meet the enemies of God.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: So we shall.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: You do so without my knights.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Then I will have the glory. You've had yours, years and years ago, Tiberias. It is time for mine.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OUTSIDE THE WALLS OF JERUSALEM. MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: TIBERIAS joins BALIAN, and they walk towards the city gat moving through the ARMY. BALIANвЂ™S MEN and TIBERIASвЂ™ M separate from the army. Reaction on the faces of the men.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: The boy is dead.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Did Guy kill him?

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: No. (Balian looks at him) He was a leper like his uncle. His mother gave him peace. (Balian starts to speak and cannot, nearly stumbles, and Tiberias holds him) She вЂњlet him goвЂќ-- and Jerusalem with him. BALIAN, shattered, nods, and walks on.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: We must look to the defenses. When Saladin destroys Guy he will come. TIBERIAS nods. BALIAN sees: the HOSPITALER, mounted, amon other knights of his order. The HOSPITALER rides out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You go with the Army?

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITALER
dialogues.text: With my Order. Have I lived? Will you remember me? What I have said to you? BALIAN nods. HOSPITALER (CONTвЂ™D) I will tell Godfrey what I have seen you become. They clasp hands. Responding to an order OS the HOSPITALE turns horse and rides off with the other knights.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE PALACE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: BALIAN moves along the hall, with Almaric and his men. A TEMPLAR GUARD interposes. BALIAN kills him. Another TEMPL begins to draw his sword. BALIAN disarms him and backs hi against the wall, dagger point at his throat. The PATRIAR sees him. BALIAN hands over the TEMPLAR GUARD to Almaric grabs the Patriarch by the throat.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Where is the Queen of Jerusalem?

dialogues.speaker: PATRIARCH
dialogues.text: Guy is head of the army...and of course a husband has rights, even over a Queen... UNDECIDED GUARDS appear. BALIAN cuts the PatriarchвЂ™s pu and throws the purse to the UNDECIDED GUARDS...who now de which way the wind is blowing, take the money, and retrea

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Are you a man, my lord bishop, who looks to his own interest? You have that reputation. The PATRIARCH nods. Yes yes yes.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you obstruct me, I will kill you. There it is.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE CRYPT. MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: SIBYLLA is praying. A key clanks in the lock. She turns a sees: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BALIAN, framed in the doorway. She stands, and lowers her eyes. BALIAN comes forward.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: It does not matter what you have done. What matters is what we do now. Sibylla looks up.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guy will lose the army. I must prepare to defend the city.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: Open the gates...If Saladin comes in his full strength we are not defensible. Not even if the army were here.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: I have...decided otherwise. When they come, they will not get in. SIBYLLA looks up as BALIAN moves fast out of the room. Th doorway is now empty.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. JERUSALEM. VARIOUS. DAY
dialogues.text: MONTAGE of BALIAN, unarmored, directing the arrangement o defenses. A broken wall swarming with MASONS. CITIZENS ar armed with PIKES and SPEARS. BALIAN supervises the placem of a BALLISTA. ETC, ETC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIBYLLA watches from a high window.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE DESERT. DAY
dialogues.text: A HUGE SHOT of the desert. At a distance of about a mile, see the ARMY OF JERUSALEM. It is straggling across the pl below two hills understood to be the Horns of Hattin. It no fine вЂњhedgehogвЂќ but a rabble baking in the sun. In shot, a BOOTED FOOT in a stirrup. REVERSE IT to reveal: SALADIN. He is staring, veiled acro Beside him, IMAD. The MULLAH rides up.

dialogues.speaker: MULLAH
dialogues.text: God wills it. SALADIN nods. MUSLIM HORSE ride up the hill.  107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIBERIAS, staring intently out into the desert, comes alo to find BALIAN, sitting rigidly on the ramparts, drinking water from a skin.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Can you sense it? BALIAN stands and looks out into the desert himself.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: I know at least that no riders have come... BALIAN nods.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HATTIN. DAY, (HELICOPTER OR CABLE)
dialogues.text: In THICK SMOKE (obscuring distances), the aftermath of th battle. Dead horses and men, tangled with their enemies. Saracens of the lower classes brawl over purses, arms. (T was, and still is, the greatest Muslim victory of all tim and the Saracens know it: they have smashed not only the of Jerusalem but the Crusades).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALADIN, stone-faced, walks over the battlefield. IMAD is with him.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: Kill the knights of the religious orders. IMAD looks taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They are fanatics and no peace will ever be made with them. They will think one thing their entire lives, and they will never stop thinking it. (bitterly, staring across the battlefield) Kill them. SALADIN walks on through the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HATTIN. LATER
dialogues.text: The TEMPLARS and HOSPITALERS are being butchered one by o by MULLAHS. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Most of the holy knights make the sign of the cross and accept martyrdom. Some try to run, an unseemly scrambling the Saracens scream. Our HOSPITALER is brought forward on the bloody ground.

dialogues.speaker: MULLAH
dialogues.text: There is no god but God. The HOSPITALER looks up at his executioner and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITALER
dialogues.text: I know. The MULLAH after a moment of confusion slashes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BALIAN lowers his head. Wind and dust. As if he is aware what has happened. He is still bowing when TiberiasвЂ™ ha touches his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: Come one. INT. SALADINвЂ™S TENT. LATER CLOSE DETAIL: SNOW is scooped into a cup, and water poure into it. SALADIN takes the cup and with his own hands gives it to GUY, who drinks, not greedily, suspecting what the hospitality means: his life. He hands the cup, thoughtlessly, sidewards to REYNALD, wh also knows what the cup means...and that neither the cup what is means was meant for him.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: (quietly) I did not give the cup to Reynald.

dialogues.speaker: REYNALD
dialogues.text: (undisturbed, drinks the last drop) I drink water for what it is. SALADIN stabs the smiling REYNALD in the throat. Blood gu out. REYNALD pitches forward on his face. SALADIN kneels besid the dying and choking REYNALD. SALADIN touches his finger REYNALDвЂ™s blood and puts a mark in blood upon his own forehead. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: REYNALD is dragged out and (as the crowd screams) butcher GUY, on reflection, is more bitter at the nature of his apparent end than afraid of it. He looks up bravely at Saladin. SALADIN (to GUYвЂ™S relief) hands his bloody sci to IMAD.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: Were you not close enough to a great king to see how to imitate one? Could you not learn by example? GUY knows he has destroyed the world. Eyes luminous in sm blackened face.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE DESERT. MORNING
dialogues.text: TIBERIAS and BALIAN are galloping with a handful of men i GodfreyвЂ™s livery. BALIAN reins in, staring ahead. He ra his arm, and points.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKY IS BLACK WITH VULTURES.
dialogues.text: They ride slowly on, and as they crest a hill, we see, as they do: THE BATTLEGROUND. Ten thousand men lied dead. Dead horses men are torn by vultures. SaladinвЂ™s army has moved on. and TIBERIAS stare. A mound of executed Templars and Hospitalers has attracted the most vultures. TIBERIAS slo makes the sign of the cross. He lowers his head. When he raises his face, he is a new man.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: I have given Jerusalem my whole life. All. There is no more.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Tiberias... TIBERIAS takes hold of the cross on his surcoat and tears off. He rides a little to the side, staring towards the 10,000 dead.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: First I thought I fought for God. Then I realized I fought for money and land. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And then I was ashamed and the King came to me and said: let us try a better world. A better world has been tried and is now impossible.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Tiberias! TIBERIAS looks at him as if for a moment he does not recognize him.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: There is no more вЂњJerusalemвЂќ. I go to Cyprus. Will you come.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: TIBERIAS
dialogues.text: Saladin must move his army from water to water. You have four days. Perhaps five. God be with you. You are the son of your father. Be without fear. God does love you. He has finished with me. BALIAN takes his hand. TIBERIAS rides off. After him, wit looks of apology at BALIAN, so do, one by one, all the me Balian sits his horse alone.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE DESERT. DAY
dialogues.text: BALIAN is riding back, hard, to Jerusalem. Out of the low ground before him come--twenty MUSLIM RIDERS, all in whit as if in death-shrouds. BALIAN turns his horse to the right (nearly putting the animal down), and sees: MORE WHITE RIDERS. Within an inst he is surrounded: SALADIN'S GUARD. BALIAN does not bother drawing a weapon. looks for a breakout as the circle closes...but then he s SALADIN. SALADIN rides forward, holding up his palm. The look at each other. Horses circling. SALADIN is veiled, unreadable.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: I knew your father. (a beat) He nearly killed me in Lebanon. On a great horse he crashed through my guard, and scattered them. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He was not five paces from me when an arrow struck through the eye of his horse. I knew his face...and his quality. We called him ibn Barzin. I did not know he had a son.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: He did. He does. 111. WHITE RIDERS come closer. SALADIN disarms BALIAN, taking Godfrey's sword.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: If you promise to fight no more against the Muslims, you may go.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: If you march on Jerusalem I cannot promise.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: I do march on Jerusalem. I will take it as it was taken, in blood. Commoners, court and Queen will die. Every soul.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Then I cannot promise not to fight you.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: Your choice is death, or that promise.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: I cannot promise.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: Then your sentence is death. BALIAN waits for it. Instead of death his is given: GODFR SWORD. Politely.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Every man dies. (he mounts) I will take Jerusalem. I cannot do otherwise. Understand.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: I must defend. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SALADIN nods, and canters away, his guard galloping after leaving Balian in the dust.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE WALLS OF JERUSALEM. DAY
dialogues.text: MANGONELS are being hoisted to the towers by Papal troops GATE is being blocked up by Masons, etc. MONTAGE of SIEGE PREPARATIONS, supervised by Balian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATTLE and FOOD are coming into the town. BALIAN, in a fu is checking his organized defences. ARMS are being distributed to a crowd.

dialogues.speaker: PATRIARCH OF JERUSALEM
dialogues.text: We must quit the city.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: And be massacred on the open road? SaladinвЂ™s cavalry is between us and the sea.

dialogues.speaker: PATRIARCH
dialogues.text: I do not mean the people. I mean us. BALIAN moves on.

dialogues.speaker: PATRIARCH OF JERUSALEM
dialogues.text: (dancing after Balian) We have not enough knights.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: (furious) Truly? BALIAN turns to a PEASANT BOY, perhaps of 16.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is your condition?

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: I am servant to the Patriarch.

dialogues.speaker: PATRIARCH OF JERUSALEM
dialogues.text: You are a slave. That is my slave!

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Is he. BALIAN jumps up on the steps of the Holy Sepulcher. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know who I am. (the crowd goes silent) None of us took this city from Muslims. No Muslim of the great army now coming against us was alive when it was lost. We fight over an offense we did not give, against those who were not alive to be offended. What is Jerusalem? Your holy places overlay the Jewish temple which the Romans pulled down. The Muslim places overlay yours. Which is more holy? The wall? The mosque? This sepulcher? Who has claim? NO ONE has claim... All have claim.

dialogues.speaker: PATRIARCH
dialogues.text: Blasphemy.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: We defend the city not to defend these stones, which are either meaningless or have too many meanings, but the people living in these walls who will die unless we do not defend them. Unless we kill the army coming against us every person in Jerusalem will die. Say that God is with you if you want, but I will trust in each of you. Trust in me. I swear not to God but to each of you that with your help I will kill SaladinвЂ™s army in front of these walls. No cheering. He jumps down. To the BOY, holding him.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are a slave? (the BOY nods) Kneel. The BOY kneels. The PATRIARCH is aghast.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Every man of arms or capable of bearing them, kneel. The CROWD kneels, BOYS, SERGEANTS, MERCHANTS, OLD PEASANT (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Be without fear in the face of your enemies. Be brave and upright, that God may love thee. Speak the truth even if it leads to your death. Safeguard the helpless. That is your oath. The BOY canвЂ™t believe is. BALIAN hits him.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to the BOY alone) And thatвЂ™s so you remember it. BALIAN goes to raise the next guy. The ManвЂ™s face raise we see: THE GRAVEDIGGER, now battle-scarred, rich. Balian smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rise a knight.

dialogues.speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
dialogues.text: Master Blacksmith.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Master Gravedigger. You have come to the right place. He moves on out of the murmuring (and emboldened) crowd. PATRIARCH OF JERUSALEM staring after him.

dialogues.speaker: PATRIARCH OF JERUSALEM
dialogues.text: (nearly crying) Does making a man a knight make him a fight better? BALIAN is surprised by the question.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: (very simply) Yes. SIBYLLA has seen it all.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. JERUSALEM. DAWN
dialogues.text: Tents are everywhere on the hills. The SARACEN ARMY is surrounding the city--at prayer. Hundreds of thousands of bow and vocalize in unison. ENGINES are in place. Their c praying. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JerusalemвЂ™s ARCHES AND SPEARMEN stare out from the wall the enormous enemy. BALIAN stands on the walls, at a tower. He looks to his s and sees: SIBYLLA. They stand together, windblown, looking out at t deaths. The prayer still continues. Allahu akhbar. Thousands bowi as one.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: Forgive me.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: Save the people from what I have done.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: I will. SIBYLLA kisses him. BALIAN looks at her heartbroken.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You had better go.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: If you wanted the world more, I would love you less. Sibylla moves along the wall. BALIAN looks chaotically ou the MUSLIM army. As prayer stops...A solitary figure beco distinct on a hill: SALADIN. He raises his palm. BALIAN, the wall, does the same.

dialogues.speaker: PATRIARCH
dialogues.text: For GodвЂ™s sake, talk terms.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: There are none. (moving along the вЂњlineвЂќ, checking machines, men) Keep your heads down. Take cover when the barrage begins...

dialogues.speaker: PATRIARCH
dialogues.text: One may convert to Islam, and repent later. It can be done. There is dispensation in these cases... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Balian looks at the cross on the PatriarchвЂ™s breast. Th does the Patriarch.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: You have taught me a great deal about religion. We hear tinkling bells, and laughter. GUY, tied backwards a tiny donkey, with a conical dunce cap on his head, is driven on display along the front of the Muslim Army, bel the walls of Jerusalem. He keeps his dignity as much as possible. SIBYLLA watches. BALIAN now with ALMARIC watches from the walls as SALADIN rides alone onto a hill, with his guard. He looks towards city. Almaric crosses himself as one cry of Allahu Akhbar rings out.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here it comes. The enormous BOMBARDMENT commences. DEFENDERS, as Balian instructed, take cover on the walls. SARACEN ENGINES exec one of the largest bombardments of the day. INT. SIBYLLAвЂ™S ROOMS. MOMENTS LATER SIBYLLA has seen it all. She removes her jewels. Then beg to remove her fine, complicated, clothes. She puts on a g shift, staring into nothingness.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BEFORE JERUSALEM. DAY
dialogues.text: MUSLIM INFANTRY (with LADDERMEN) moves forward, slowly, a then at a run. CROSSBOWMEN slaughter the men below. ENGINES FIRE and as the MUSLIM ARMY screams and Saracen d beat, a SIEGE TOWER, ARCHES firing from its platform, is pushed towards the wall. It has caught fire in two or thr places. LADDERMEN run alongside the tower. SPRAYS OF STON from Mangonels tear through the Saracens and rock the tow

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE WALLS OF JERUSALEM. LATER
dialogues.text: DEFENDERS wait. CROSSBOWMEN fire and FLAMING ARROWS are fired. BALIAN watches. The SIEGE TOWER comes within ten f of the wall and as a great RAMP descends, hundreds of MUS charge forward into PIKEMEN. They are staved off, Balian the center of the repulse catches an arrow through the le wrist. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: (clutching the arm) Now! From a TOWER to the side, two GRAPNELS are thrown. Were i not Balian the artificer managing things, this may or may have been effective, but the instant the grapnels catch ( are hand-tightened), BALIAN waves his arm. The two lines to a DERRICK which is holding up a stone the size of a sm cottage. A line is cut (killing, as it snaps, the man who it), and the weight of the stone jerks the SIEGE TOWER to pieces. It literally explodes. Debris, burning beams, kno MUSLIM LADDERMEN off the walls. The wreckage collapses ba on the infantry tightly packed behind the tower, killing scores. BALIAN watches: and nods at Almaric.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CATACOMBS. NIGHT
dialogues.text: BALIAN moves through the rows of wounded and dead. A PHYSICIAN cuts the jugular of a smashed man and the blood caught in a basin. BALIAN sits to have his hand bound. Th FINGER is parted from the hand, and put in a basin. The h is washed, and wrapped. A CLOAKED WOMAN does the bandagin She raises her eyes. Sibylla. BALIAN looks at her evenly. Then wordlessly he embraces her, staring past her bent he SIBYLLA weeping.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE WALLS OF JERUSALEM. DAY
dialogues.text: SPEARMEN knock over the ladders that have been gotten up. melee along the walls. BALIAN, moving through smoke, wave his arm, and GREEK FIRE is flung straight down into the infantry. As hundreds of Saracens burn...CROSSBOWMEN en m come forward to crowd the walls and begin to slaughter th Saracens.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ANOTHER WALL OF JERUSALEM. LATER
dialogues.text: As MUSLIMS in the thousands mass with ladders beneath ano wall....GREAT WOODEN TRAYS running the length of the wall levered up by a hundred men, and pour stones down, smashi thousands of tightly-massed men (the lumber follows, tumb down). As a SECOND WAVE of Saracens presses forward over smashed men, GREEK FIRE jets from pipes fixed to the wall igniting men as well as the smashed wooden trays. Men on run everywhere, and fall burning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As MUSLIMS advance, tens, scores, fall into concealed kil pits of sharpened stakes, and even as they are surprised them...begin to reconsider the assault, an arches fires a flaming arrow into...A FIELD OF PITCH. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: An area of about an acre has been covered with pitch and straw and dirt. It goes up like an oil-rig fire, fierce enough to drive defenders back from the walls. This part the Muslim army is entirely incinerated.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. JERUSALEM. NIGHT
dialogues.text: CATAPULTS are being worked non-stop by the Saracens, and walls are being struck, hard. The walls are coming down.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. JERUSALEM. DAY
dialogues.text: Concentrated catapult fire is collapsing a wall. It sudde shivers down, from the bottom, the stone pouring out into great apron. And the MUSLIM ARMY is ready. SALADIN rides along the front of his force.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: Not one alive. Not one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHIELD WALL forms, BALIAN directing it. Defenders (all knights there are, including the first BOY made Knight) g shield to shield. ARCHES and CROSSBOWMEN take elevated positions behind. As Muslim army of thousands advances at a run, ready to kill Christians at a single rush, BALIAN looks to his left in shield wall and sees: THE GRAVEDIGGER. They nod at each other. The SARACEN ARCHES fire a volley of arrows and the INFANTRY charges. This is their chance: they will take Jerusalem at this rush and are not afraid of martyrdom. N arrows oppose them: merely the waiting knights in the bro wall. But they break on the line, hacked down, man after by the heavily armored knights. There is no need to screa keep the line: the line is kept, by the knights and the в knightsвЂќ with them. Dissolve in the fighting to:

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE BREACH IN THE WALL. DAWN
dialogues.text: BALIAN, blood-covered and thirsty, wakes from a doze. KNI are leaning on their swords, or lying on the ground, coughing. We see that the line of defense is marked by immense piles of dead. Saracens tangled with Europeans in the breech in the wall. Hundreds of dead: thousands perha The defense of the breach has nearly killed the SaladinвЂ infantry. BALIAN wanders, stumbling, among the bodies. Th GRAVEDIGGER lies dead, hacked across the face.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Remember me in France. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ON SOUND (as Balian looks at the butchery by daylight): T MUSLIM ARMY is called to prayer. From the walls of Jerusa we see the whole army praying.

dialogues.speaker: ALMARIC
dialogues.text: (covered with blood) They will ask for terms. They will ask for terms. EXT. BEFORE SALADINвЂ™S TENT. DAY Saladin waits mildly as BALIAN comes through the crowd, escorted. As he comes through: the Arabs look at him with interest, many salaaming. BALIAN, awkwardly, returns the salaam. GUY, no longer tie the donkey, is being treated as SaladinвЂ™s guest. Rubbin wrists and staring at Balian with a strange look of hatre and admiration mixed.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: We must discuss Jerusalem. ItвЂ™s King (nods at Guy) has surrendered it but there seems to be a difficulty.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: You offered no quarter and we ask one. What has changed?

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: Will you yield the city?

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Before I lose it I will burn it to the ground. Your holy places. Ours. Every last thing in Jerusalem that drives men mad.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: I wonder if it would not be better if you did. (looks reflectively at the city) You will destroy it?

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Every stone. And every Christian knight you kill will take ten Saracens with him. You will kill your army here and never raise another. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I swear to God that to take this city will be the end of you.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: You cannot stand another assault.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Make one, and we will see. GUY is watching, fascinated, what he might have been.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: Your city is full of women, and children. There will be disease, soon, from the dead. If my army will die, and so will your city.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: (swallows, knowing that it is true) Do you offer terms? I ask none. SALADIN walks apart. Long pause. Then he turns.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: I will give every soul safe-conduct to Christian lands. Every soul. The women, the children, the old, and all your knights and soldiers. Your Queen. Your King... (GUY tenses) I leave to what God will make of him. MULLAHS object. BALIAN staring at SALADIN stares at Balia with hatred.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No one will be robbed or harmed, I swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: The Christians butchered every Muslim within the walls when they took this city.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: I am not those men. I am Saladin.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Then on these terms I surrender Jerusalem.  121.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE GATE. DAY
dialogues.text: BALIAN comes back in through the gate. SIBYLLA stands the in her simple clothing.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: We surrender the city in the morning, and will be safely escorted to the sea.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: The nobles...

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Everyone is safe to go. I would not have surrendered otherwise. SIBYLLA looks distraught at Jerusalem.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If this is GodвЂ™s kingdom he can dispose of it as he likes. Your brotherвЂ™s kingdom was here. (he touches her heart) That kingdom is not surrendered.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. INSIDE THE WALLS OF JERUSALEM. LATER
dialogues.text: In the square before the palace Christians with their goo loaded are forming caravans. BALIAN, moving among them, mounted, suddenly looks around as...GUY, fully armed, lea destrier over some baggage and slams at a gallop into BalianвЂ™s horse. BALIANвЂ™S horse goes down screaming. B rolls in the dust. Guy rides around him.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: They say now you are beloved by God. How much of that am I to take? There is already a song about Jerusalem and its false and wicked king. GUY takes a battle axe from a retainer.

dialogues.speaker: GUY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They would have tried to marry her to a bucket, or a Saracen if it would have kept their world intact. I donвЂ™t mind that you fucked her, for are we not all French...but... (smiles) I am not a bad man. I am only a man making my way. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GUY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am simply making my way. As all men are...except for you. Do you think you are a perfect knight? Do you? Do you?

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: I am not the man who lost the Kingdom of Jerusalem. As Balian walks away, GUY turns his horse to ride him dow A CHORUS OF KNIGHTS dismount and fight him. GUY realizes he must. He dismounts. He draws his sword. BALIAN waits for him. GUY moves like lightning and cuts a gash in BalianвЂ™s face. BALIAN waits. In a quick passage, Guy disarms Balian, who scrambles and picks up his sword again. There is no quest Guy is state of the art. BALIAN stands waiting. GUY moves kill him. The Men collide, and GUY, spinning away, eludes backswing, catches the blade with his hand, drives it dow into the ground, and returns a blow that would have cut o BalianвЂ™s head--except that Balian parries it, surprisin KNIGHTS and MUSLIMS crowd close, shouting. They know thei sport: and out of nowhere they are at the World Cup. GUY really lays in--state of the art--and Balian, clumsily, m every blow. The two men go at it for sixty seconds straig in an exhausting high speed flurry which includes blows i the face with gloved fists. GUY with a broken nose, breat hard (presumably seeing stars), takes a low guard, and BALIAN, wounded twice, takes a high one. A SARACEN KNIGHT makes a detailed bet with a CHRISTIAN ONE. GUY is still surprised by the blood coming from his nose and is repell Balian almost idly. BALIAN missed a blow and crashes into wall. GuyвЂ™s sword striking where BalianвЂ™s head was a before. BALIAN lunges and GUY, letting him pass, crashes pommel of his sword down on the back of hi head. BALIAN sprawls on the cobbles. GUY goes after him, cuts, misses, wounded in the side by a thrust. GUY parries a second blo and stabs BALIAN (we cannot tell where or how badly) and attacks violently, relentlessly. The crowd follows the exhausted fighters, who face each other, bleeding, breathless, barely on their feet.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Water. It is given him in a skin by one of his knights. GUY goes forward purposefully, to kill BALIAN. BALIAN, staggering, waits. GUY cuts low, Balian, out of breath, barely parrie GUY advances to kill him. BALIAN waits, at the high guard (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BALIAN is cut, badly, in the next pass. BALIAN takes the вЂњhigh guardвЂќ again. He watches Guy (which is to say h death) advance.

dialogues.speaker: GUY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (advancing) вЂњBe brave and upright that God may love thee. Be without fear in the face of your enemies.вЂќ We've all heard the words. How dare you believe them. How dare you. GUY goes for the kill in a move weвЂ™ve seen before. BALI parries as he once did with GODFREY but instead of losing sword as he did long ago in the French wood he meets the blow and then cuts Guy across the throat. GUY falls to his knees, trying to speak. He pitches forwa BALIAN, holding Godfrey's sword, stares down at him.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE PALACE. DAY
dialogues.text: BALIAN, his wounds bound by MUSLIM PHYSICIANS, stands. Th PHYSICIANS back away respectfully. He moves into the corridor. MUSLIMS are moving through the palace, taking possession. BALIAN looks into TIBERIASвЂ™ ROOM. The room all MUSLIM CLERKS, going through papers. Balian looks aro and sees that SALADIN is standing beside him, alone.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: So.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: My lord.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: I admire the Franks for their courage. It is said that I have learned chivalry from them. Have you heard this? BALIAN laughs. Saladin smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: вЂњChivalryвЂќ. It is like faith. When it is true it is good. (hands on BalianвЂ™s shoulder) I like nothing better than an honorable man. Starts to go. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BAIL
dialogues.text: What is Jerusalem worth?

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN
dialogues.text: Nothing. SALADIN is now walking back along the hall of the capture palace.

dialogues.speaker: SALADIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everything. INT. SIBYLLAвЂ™S ROOMS. MOMENTS LATER SIBYLLA is sitting before a dressing-mirror. A distorting sheet of polished metal. Staring at an image which is unclear. She is aware of Balian behind her.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: I am still the Queen of Acre, of Tripolis, of Ascalon.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: And I am still a knight. And that is all. She stands, and looks at him. BALIAN stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: What shall I decide?

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: It is simple. Decide not to be a Queen and I will come to you. BALIAN has come to the end of the room. He hesitates; and then goes out through the curtains.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE DAVID GATE. DAY
dialogues.text: A very orderly Christian evacuation. BALIAN joins it, on foot. IMAD appears, holding the magnificent horse that Ba gave him some time ago.

dialogues.speaker: IMAD
dialogues.text: (wrily) It is not a very good horse. I will not keep it. (Balian takes the bridle) We will meet again.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: If we do not? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: IMAD
dialogues.text: Taking it poorly bakes no bread. IMAD walks away into the crowd. Balian leads his horse saddened; but free. GUYвЂ™S KNIGHTS trudge past and each them salute Balian. He returns the nod; rides along the h stream of refugees...all of whom he has saved. As he begi to be recognized...he pulls the hood of his cloak over hi head. As he looks back at Jerusalem... SARACEN ENGINEERS on top of the church throw down the cro that surmounts it. It crashes to the stones in front of t Temple and is broken to pieces by Saracens. MUSLIMS are taking possession of the temple. SALADIN is walking, bein cheered. MUSLIMS on rooftops, in the streets, acclaiming Saladin.

dialogues.speaker: INT. INSIDE THE TEMPLE. DAY
dialogues.text: Rose-water is being splashed on the flags of what has bee Christian church. It is being purified by MULLAHS. SALADI stands in the doorway with IMAD and the MULLAH.

dialogues.speaker: MULLAH
dialogues.text: God has favored us with victory. All the glory is God's. SALADIN walks away from the Mullah. The MULLAH would foll but IMAD stops him. SALADIN washes, preparing to pray alo He lays his mat, and, lowering his head, prays.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE ROAD TO THE COAST. DAY, (ENDING ONE)
dialogues.text: The city is no longer visible. THE CHRISTIAN REFUGEES, escorted by Muslim horsemen, trudge through the desert. A WOMAN walks along the edge of the stony road. BALIAN move along the line. At first he almost passes the woman. He r alongisde her for a while. Then dismounts. BALIAN walks h horse beside the dusty figure.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: A Queen never walks.

dialogues.speaker: SIBYLLA
dialogues.text: No. (a beat) And yet I am walking.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: Some say that Jerusalem is the center of the world for forgiveness. For myself, I call it here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SIBYLLA nods, and keeps walking beside him. BALIAN leads horse on, exhausted. They walk together towards the sea. REFUGEES sing in French, walking through the Holy Land, heading towards the distant sea. BALIAN tears the cross from his tunic but cannot throw it the ground. He puts it in his sleeve. Fantastical SARACEN KNIGHTS ride along the column, silk billowing, singing th own song in Arabic. BALIAN watches them pass, then rides on, hooded, head dow In a perfect MATCH, SNOW begins to fly past his bent head turns his horse, dismounts, and we see that he is at the forge. He stands, looking around at the land, the orchard SOUND: HORSES. BALIAN finally stands and looks, raising h hood. CRUSADERS. THE LION OF ENGLAND. Gold on a red tunic RICHARDвЂ™S KNIGHT We crusade to recover the Kingdom of Jerusalem.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: You go to where the men speak Italian and then continue till they speak something else. RICHARDвЂ™S KNIGHT We have come by this road to find the lord who was defender of Jerusalem.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: (bowing) I am the blacksmith. RICHARD COUER DE LION sits his horse, staring at Balian. CRUSADERS pass behind.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: And I am the king of England.

dialogues.speaker: BALIAN
dialogues.text: I am the blacksmith. He bows. RICHARD COUER DE LION looks at Balian knowing ve well who he is. (He sees the armor lashed to a packhorse) But he nods and rides on. BALIAN turns from the passing Crusaders and enters his old kitchen garden to see A YOUN TREE. It is one of the trees planted by his wife. He touc the leaves. Balian raises his hood against the falling sn and moves on to turns to see, at a distance, SIBYLLA, watching him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BALIAN walks his horse to join her.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE CROSSROADS. LATER
dialogues.text: BALIAN AND SIBYLLA canter through the crossroads and past local lordвЂ™s castle without looking back. BLACK.
